name: Water
storage: Store at room temperature; avoid freezing
spill_procedures: No action needed — wipe or dry

regulatory.Other: Not regulated by OSHA, IARC, NTP

name: Sodium Hydroxide
handling: Avoid spills and splashes; do not inhale mist

first_aid.skin: Rinse for 15 mins, remove contaminated clothing
first_aid.eyes: Flush for 15 mins, seek medical help
first_aid.ingestion: Do not induce vomiting; rinse mouth and get medical help

disposal: Neutralize and flush down the drain with water (check local regulations); Do not mix with acids
incompatibilities: Reacts violently with acids, ammonium salts
storage: Store in plastic bottles, tightly closed; avoid CO₂ exposure
spill_procedures: Neutralize with dilute acetic acid; mop with water
environmental_hazard: Harmful to aquatic life at high concentration

name: Potassium Hydrogen Phthalate
handling: Avoid creating dust; do not inhale powders
disposal: Small quantities in inorganic solid waste; solutions flushed if pH is neutral
storage: Store dry, sealed in cool space
spill_procedures: Sweep solid carefully; avoid dust; rinse area

name: Benzoic Acid

first_aid.ingestion: Rinse mouth; seek medical help if discomfort occurs

disposal: Organic liquid waste container; do not pour down the drain

name: Phthalic Acid
handling: Avoid contact with eyes and prolonged skin exposure

first_aid.ingestion: Rinse mouth and consult health services

disposal: Organic liquid waste; do not flush without neutralization and instructor approval
storage: Keep tightly closed in dry conditions
spill_procedures: Dilute and wipe with water; no fumes expected
environmental_hazard: Harmful in large quantities; avoid drain disposal in bulk

name: Phenolphthalein
hazard_status: Flammable; possible carcinogen in large doses
handling: Keep away from open flame or heat; use in well-ventilated area
disposal: Organic liquid waste container; do not pour down the drain
storage: Store in flammables cabinet; keep sealed, away from heat
spill_procedures: Absorb with paper towel or sand; ventilate area
environmental_hazard: Flammable; toxic in large aquatic doses

name: Sodium Benzoate
handling: Avoid inhalation and contact with skin or eyes; use with adequate ventilation

first_aid.ingestion: Rinse mouth, do not induce vomiting

disposal: Dispose via solid waste container; follow local regulations
incompatibilities: Avoid strong oxidizing agents and strong acids
storage: Store in a cool, dry, well-ventilated area; keep sealed and away from moisture
spill_procedures: Sweep up gently; avoid dust formation; wipe area with water

regulatory.Other: Not regulated by OSHA, IARC, or NTP

environmental_hazard: Low toxicity in small quantities; biodegradable

name: Sodium Phthalate
handling: Avoid dust formation; use with adequate ventilation

first_aid.skin: Rinse with water and remove contaminated clothing
first_aid.eyes: Flush eyes with water for at least 15 minutes
first_aid.ingestion: Do not induce vomiting; rinse mouth with water

disposal: Dispose in solid inorganic waste; neutralize before flushing if in solution
incompatibilities: Avoid contact with strong oxidizing agents
storage: Store in tightly closed container in a dry, well-ventilated area
spill_procedures: Sweep or vacuum up and place in appropriate disposal container
environmental_hazard: Minimal; avoid large quantity discharge into waterways

name: Sodium Phenolphthalein
handling: Avoid inhalation of dust or contact with eyes and skin

first_aid.ingestion: Rinse mouth; seek medical advice if symptoms persist

disposal: Dispose in organic solid waste container; follow lab disposal policy
storage: Store tightly sealed in cool, dry place
spill_procedures: Avoid dust; sweep solid and wipe area with damp cloth
environmental_hazard: Potential aquatic hazard in large quantities

name: Potassium Benzoate
handling: Avoid inhalation of dust; handle with standard lab practices

first_aid.ingestion: Rinse mouth; not expected to be harmful in small quantities

disposal: Can be disposed of in drain with plenty of water (check local regulations)
storage: Store tightly sealed in a dry, cool environment
spill_procedures: Sweep up solid; clean area with water
environmental_hazard: Low hazard; biodegradable in small amounts

name: Potassium Phthalate
handling: Avoid generating dust; use in ventilated area

first_aid.eyes: Flush with water for at least 15 minutes
first_aid.ingestion: Rinse mouth; drink water if needed

disposal: Dispose of as inorganic solid waste; solutions may be flushed if pH-neutral
storage: Store in a cool, dry place; keep sealed
spill_procedures: Sweep up with minimal dust; rinse area with water
environmental_hazard: Minimal; avoid release in large quantities

name: Potassium Sodium Phthalate
handling: Avoid inhalation of dust; handle with care in dry form

first_aid.skin: Wash with water; remove contaminated clothing

disposal: Dispose as inorganic salt waste or according to local regulations
incompatibilities: Avoid strong acids and oxidizing agents
storage: Keep container tightly closed in a dry, well-ventilated area
spill_procedures: Sweep up without creating dust; wash area with water
environmental_hazard: Low; avoid release of large amounts into drains

name: Potassium Sodium Tartrate
handling: Handle with standard lab precautions; avoid dust

first_aid.eyes: Flush eyes with water for 10–15 minutes
first_aid.ingestion: Rinse mouth; not expected to be harmful in small quantities

disposal: Flush small quantities with water; check local regulations
storage: Store in tightly sealed container in a dry, cool place
spill_procedures: Sweep up solid; wipe area with water

regulatory.FDA: Approved for food use (in small amounts)

environmental_hazard: Low risk; biodegradable and non-toxic in small quantities

name: Potassium Phenolphthalein Phthalate
handling: Avoid inhalation of powders and skin/eye contact

first_aid.ingestion: Rinse mouth; seek medical attention if symptoms persist

disposal: Dispose in accordance with local environmental regulations; treat as organic chemical waste
storage: Keep container tightly closed in a dry, well-ventilated place
spill_procedures: Avoid dust formation; sweep up and dispose in chemical waste
environmental_hazard: Low hazard in small quantities; avoid large releases into environment

name: Potassium Hydroxide
handling: Avoid contact with skin and eyes; do not breathe dust or mist

first_aid.skin: Rinse with water for at least 15 minutes; remove contaminated clothing
first_aid.eyes: Flush eyes with water for at least 15 minutes; seek medical attention
first_aid.inhalation: Move to fresh air; seek medical help if symptoms persist
first_aid.ingestion: Rinse mouth; do not induce vomiting; get medical attention

disposal: Neutralize with dilute acid and dilute with water; follow local regulations
incompatibilities: Reacts violently with acids and strong oxidizers
storage: Store in tightly sealed container in cool, dry place; protect from CO₂
spill_procedures: Neutralize with dilute acetic acid; clean with water; avoid contact

regulatory.SARA: SARA 311/312 hazard categories: Immediate (acute) health hazard

environmental_hazard: Toxic to aquatic life in large concentrations; avoid release to environment
